Description de poste:

Rejoignez l’équipe de Recherche et Innovation d’EcoAct et aidez-nous à accroître notre impact dans la lutte contre le changement climatique et pour la nature !
Votre mission
Sous la responsabilité d’un consultant chercheur, vos principales missions seront l’exploration de la littérature et des bases de données existantes afin de développer et améliorer les outils internes d’EcoAct, utilisés par les consultants dans le cadre de missions clients. Vous aurez la responsabilité de la construction de nouvelles bases de données climat et biodiversité, du développement de modèles d’estimation ESG, et vous assisterez les différentes équipes en tant qu’analyste de données climat et biodiversité. Vous pourrez également être amenés à intervenir comme support technique aux consultants au cours de missions clients.
Vous dirigerez et approfondirez un projet de recherche tout au long de votre stage, en vous concentrant sur les besoins identifiés par vos collègues. Vous serez également amenés à vous approprier les modèles d’estimations de GES corporate basés sur l’Intelligence Artificielle développés par EcoAct, et à les améliorer en approfondissant la recherche sur certains secteurs d’activités clés des entreprises.
Vous travaillerez directement avec les consultants et managers (de toutes les Regional Business Units) qui ont fait part de leurs besoins en matière de nouvelles bases de données et de nouveaux outils. Vous travaillerez également en étroite collaboration avec les membres de l’équipe Climate Data Analytics (CDA) pour les aider à intégrer et déployer les bases de données et outils développés.
Vos principales tâches seront les suivantes (liste non exhaustive) :
Développement et mise à jour de bases de données et de scénarios :
Explorer la littérature et les bases de données pertinentes sur le climat et la biodiversité.
Collecter des données pour améliorer les capacités analytiques d’EcoAct.
Développer de nouvelles bases de données et nouveaux scénarios pour soutenir les projets en cours, et futurs.
Mettre à jour et entretenir les bases de données existantes, afin d’en garantir l’exactitude et la pertinence.
Modélisation climat ou biodiversité, basé sur l’IA :
Travailler sur un projet de modélisation en ayant recours à des méthodes et algorithmes basés sur l’IA, en vous concentrant sur les besoins identifiés par vos collègues.
Appropriation des modèles d’estimations d’émissions GES d’entreprises, approfondissement pour certains secteurs clés et support technique sur les missions ayant recours à ces modèles.
Analyse de données :
Assister les différentes équipes en leur fournissant des informations et analyses de données utiles.
Participer à des projets clients en tant que support technique sur les aspects data.

Greenly is a B corp certified SaaS founded in 2019 by Alexis, Matthieu and Arnaud. It allows each company to easily track their carbon footprint, to take part in the fight against climate change.
More than 2000 companies have already trusted Greenly to effectively reduce their greenhouse gas emissions. With Greenly, companies measure accurately, reduce sustainably, contribute intelligently and report on their progress.
Our platform combines smart data collection with advanced features to create the world’s most intuitive carbon accounting solution. On top of that, Greenly also offers the personalised guidance of a Climate Expert throughout the client’s journey!
Joining our teams means being a part of a young growing dynamic family of 140+ hard workers.

Deliver with agility | Work in small increments: fail fast, learn fast, win fast

 About the role
At Greenly, we are dedicated to empowering companies with the tools they need to understand and reduce their carbon footprint through our platform. As we continue to grow and refine our product offerings, we're excited to bring on a new Data Analyst who will play an important role in shaping the future of our platform.
As a Data Analyst Intern at Greenly, you will be at the forefront of our data-driven initiatives, with a focus on product performance and users’ behaviour. You’ll work closely with our product builders to impact how our clients are interacting with the platform.
To do this, you will be collaborating with cross functional teams including marketing, product, and delivery, while being mentored closely by Joshua, our current Data Analyst, to manage and optimise dashboards, analyses, and event triggers in the product.
You will be not only working on a variety of high impact projects but also bridging the gaps between teams with the data tools you master.
What you will do...
Use tools like Retool, Mixpanel, and Metabase to develop dashboards and visualisations that help decision-making across our product, marketing, and delivery teams.
Analyse user behaviour, operational efficiency, and product performance to identify correlations and provide actionable insights.
Design and develop dashboards for the marketing team to monitor website conversions and user behaviour, helping to optimise marketing strategies.
Collaborate with product builders to identify KPIs, create dashboards, and convert strong product performance into high user retention.
Analyse and monitor the delivery process to identify delivery bottlenecks and use data-driven insights to improve operational efficiency.

You would describe yourself as being analytic, curious, and a great communicator.
You have proven ability to manage data visualisation projects from concept to execution.
You have excellent analytical skills with a focus on deriving actionable insights from data.
Are proficient working on SQL to query databases. Experience with PostgreSQL or BigQuery is highly desirable but not mandatory.
Have experience working with Data Analytical Tools.
Proficiency in tools such as Mixpanel or Metabase is a plus.
Knowledge of coding is a plus (javascript/Python).
Your spoken and written English skills are solid.

Nous recherchons un Data Scientist pour rejoindre notre équipe dynamique et contribuer à l'analyse avancée de données dans le cadre de projets stratégiques. Sous la responsabilité hiérarchique d’un Manager Data Science, le Data Scientist travaillera en étroite collaboration avec les équipes techniques et métier pour transformer les données en informations stratégiques et en actions concrètes.

Mener des actions de recherches sur des technologies de pointes, de nouvelles sources de données et prototyper des solutions « sur étagère » au service des entités du Groupe,
Réaliser une veille active à des fins de R&D, dans le cadre des partenariats noués et de manière directe.

Contexte et atouts du poste
You will work in the context of the project REWIND (pRecision mEdecine WIth longitudinal Data), a multicentric project (Paris, Bordeaux, Lyon, Grenoble, Nice) granted via the “Investissement d’avenir” PEPR Santé Numérique. The project will focus on the development of new mathematical and statistical approaches for the analysis of multimodal multiscale longitudinal data. These models will be designed, implemented as prototypes and then transferred to an easy-used-well-documented platform where researchers from diverse communities, in particular physicians, will be able to analyze their own data set. The project will allow the development of a new generation of decision support systems, which will help clinicians at the bedside to make more informed decisions for the patient. They will contribute to the development of precision medicine in several key areas.

In this context, you will work in two teams: HeKA (Inria-Inserm-Université Paris Cité) and ARAMIS lab (Inria, CNRS, Inserm and Sorbonne Université). HeKA is located at the PariSanté Campus (https://parisantecampus.fr), while the ARAMIS lab is located at the Paris Brain Institute (https://institutducerveau-icm.org). While HeKA aims at developing methods, models, and tools to create, evaluate and validate learning health systems, ARAMIS lab is dedicated to the development of new computational approaches for the analysis of large neuroimaging and clinical datasets.

You will be strongly involved in scientific aspects of the work, such as discussion of methodological issues and interpretation of results. You will interact locally with the PhD students, postdoctoral fellows and engineers. You will take part in the communications and publications resulting from the use of the software.
Mission confiée
The ARAMIS lab develops the open-source software Leaspy [1,2,3] (https://leaspy.readthedocs.io/en/stable/, https://gitlab.com/icm-institute/aramislab/leaspy), a Python library for the statistical analysis of longitudinal data, particularly medical data that comes in the form of repeated observations of patients at different time points. Leaspy allows users to easily fit various models to large-scale clinical studies consisting of clinical scores, cognitive assessments, physiological measurements, or imaging-derived data. Leaspy aims at recombining these series to reconstruct the long-term spatio-temporal trajectory of disease evolution. Each patient can then be positioned relative to the group-average timeline, in terms of both the temporal and spatial differences. Future observations as well as virtual patient trajectories can then be simulated. Leaspy is distributed freely to the scientific community and has users worldwide. It has been used to produce high impact medical publications that have advanced the understanding of neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer’s disease, fronto-temporal dementia and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis [4,5,6,7].

You will be in charge of the:

development of new features (implementation of new models, algorithms, metrics, visualizations),

user support and animation of the community.

In addition, you will be presenting the software at international scientific conferences and other events (organized for instance by Inria, ICM, CNRS…). Finally, you will contribute to ambitious medical studies, by using Leaspy on large databases of patients, contributing to the interpretation of results and providing assistance to users (internal to the lab and external collaborators).

job_name: Research engineer Statistical analysis of longitudinal medical data
job_text:
Le descriptif de l’offre ci-dessous est en Anglais
Contrat renouvelable : Oui
Niveau de diplôme exigé : Bac + 5 ou équivalent
Fonction : Ingénieur scientifique contractuel
Contexte et atouts du poste
You will work in the context of the project REWIND (pRecision mEdecine WIth longitudinal Data), a multicentric project (Paris, Bordeaux, Lyon, Grenoble, Nice) granted via the “Investissement d’avenir” PEPR Santé Numérique. The project will focus on the development of new mathematical and statistical approaches for the analysis of multimodal multiscale longitudinal data. These models will be designed, implemented as prototypes and then transferred to an easy-used-well-documented platform where researchers from diverse communities, in particular physicians, will be able to analyze their own data set. The project will allow the development of a new generation of decision support systems, which will help clinicians at the bedside to make more informed decisions for the patient. They will contribute to the development of precision medicine in several key areas.

In this context, you will work in two teams: HeKA (Inria-Inserm-Université Paris Cité) and ARAMIS lab (Inria, CNRS, Inserm and Sorbonne Université). HeKA is located at the PariSanté Campus (https://parisantecampus.fr), while the ARAMIS lab is located at the Paris Brain Institute (https://institutducerveau-icm.org). While HeKA aims at developing methods, models, and tools to create, evaluate and validate learning health systems, ARAMIS lab is dedicated to the development of new computational approaches for the analysis of large neuroimaging and clinical datasets.

You will be strongly involved in scientific aspects of the work, such as discussion of methodological issues and interpretation of results. You will interact locally with the PhD students, postdoctoral fellows and engineers. You will take part in the communications and publications resulting from the use of the software.
Mission confiée
The ARAMIS lab develops the open-source software Leaspy [1,2,3] (https://leaspy.readthedocs.io/en/stable/, https://gitlab.com/icm-institute/aramislab/leaspy), a Python library for the statistical analysis of longitudinal data, particularly medical data that comes in the form of repeated observations of patients at different time points. Leaspy allows users to easily fit various models to large-scale clinical studies consisting of clinical scores, cognitive assessments, physiological measurements, or imaging-derived data. Leaspy aims at recombining these series to reconstruct the long-term spatio-temporal trajectory of disease evolution. Each patient can then be positioned relative to the group-average timeline, in terms of both the temporal and spatial differences. Future observations as well as virtual patient trajectories can then be simulated. Leaspy is distributed freely to the scientific community and has users worldwide. It has been used to produce high impact medical publications that have advanced the understanding of neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer’s disease, fronto-temporal dementia and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis [4,5,6,7].

Principales activités
You will be in charge of the:

development of new features (implementation of new models, algorithms, metrics, visualizations),
software maintenance,
user support and animation of the community.

In addition, you will be presenting the software at international scientific conferences and other events (organized for instance by Inria, ICM, CNRS…). Finally, you will contribute to ambitious medical studies, by using Leaspy on large databases of patients, contributing to the interpretation of results and providing assistance to users (internal to the lab and external collaborators).

A propos du centre ou de la direction fonctionnelle
The Inria center at Université Côte d'Azur includes 42 research teams and 9 support services. The center’s staff (about 500 people) is made up of scientists of diﬀerent nationalities, engineers, technicians and administrative staff. The teams are mainly located on the university campuses of Sophia Antipolis and Nice as well as Montpellier, in close collaboration with research and higher education laboratories and establishments (Université Côte d'Azur, CNRS, INRAE, INSERM ...), but also with the regional economic players.

With a presence in the fields of computational neuroscience and biology, data science and modeling, software engineering and certification, as well as collaborative robotics, the Inria Centre at Université Côte d'Azur is a major player in terms of scientific excellence through its results and collaborations at both European and international levels.
Contexte et atouts du poste
Inria, the French National Institute for Computer Science and Applied Mathematics, promotes “scientific excellence for technology transfer and society”. Graduates from the world’s top universities, Inria's 2,700 employees rise to the challenges of digital sciences. With its open, agile model, Inria can explore original approaches with its partners in industry and academia and provide an efficient response to the multidisciplinary and application challenges of digital transformation. Inria is the source of many innovations that add value and create jobs.

Team

The STARS research team combines advanced theory with cutting-edge practice focusing on cognitive vision systems.

Team web site : https://team.inria.fr/stars/

Scientific context

STARS group works on automatic video monitoring and human behavior understanding for health applications. The Deep Learning platform developed in STARS, detects mobile objects, tracks their trajectory, and recognizes related behaviors predefined by experts. This platform contains several techniques for detecting people and for recognizing human postures/gestures using conventional cameras. However, there are scientific challenges in people tracking when dealing with real-world scenes: cluttered scenes, handling wrong and incomplete person segmentation, handling static and dynamic occlusions, low contrasted objects, moving contextual objects (e.g. chairs), similar appearance of clothes among different people ...

This Project aims to detect critical situations in the daily life of elderly people living at home alone. We believe that a system that can detect potentially dangerous situations will give peace of mind to frail older people as well as to their caregivers.
This will require not only recognition of ADLs but also an evaluation of the way and timing in which they are being carried out.
The users we are targeting should be in relatively good health condition. We do not want to address serious dementia problems but intend to give support to people who suffer from age-related forgetfulness (in many cases the start of an Alzheimer's condition). The users should live in their own house by themselves and generally be able to carry out their day-to-day activities. The system we want to develop is intended to help them and their relatives feel more comfortable because they know potentially dangerous situations will be detected and reported to caregivers if necessary
Mission confiée
Addiction is a chronic, relapsing brain disorder characterized by compulsive drug seeking and use despite knowledge of its harmful consequences. The risk of relapse is one of the main problems encountered in treatment programs for addiction to substances (e.g. tobacco, alcohol, opioids). In the case of nicotine dependence, the factors relapse are dominated by nervousness, post-traumatic stress, the presence of a history of depression, as well as changes in family, social or professional situation1.

Research is therefore needed to predict relapses as early as possible, and to propose effective treatments adapted to each patient in order to limit the risk of relapse.

The aim of the current research project is to develop artificial intelligence (AI) methods based on computer vision approaches to automate and enrich the characterization of relapse in patients suffering from nicotine dependence at the affective and and emotional levels. The project is based on filmed assessments recorded as part of routine clinical practice in the Addictology Department at Paul Brousse Hospital in Villejuif.

Kpitaine est une société d’édition logiciel engagée dans la transition pour l’industrie 5.0. Notre mission est de démocratiser le management par les données pour associer performance et bien-être pour l’industrie. Concrètement, nous installons des écrans tactiles au sein des usines afin de diffuser de l’information aux équipes ; animer leurs meetings quotidiens ; remonter, gérer ou escalader les problèmes rencontrés.

Notre solution est une plateforme SaaS qui permet de


structurer une communication efficace au sein des industries
gérer de manière centralisée un parc d’affichage au plus proche du terrain
mettre à disposition des outils de management visuel permettant d’animer les points des équipes terrains et de remonter l’information

Notre solution compte aujourd’hui deux outils principaux


Cockpit permettant de récupérer les informations à diffuser, d’organiser celles-ci sous forme de présentations et de planifier leur diffusion sur les écrans
Eurêka qui est outil de ticket adapté aux processus de résolution des problèmes de l’industrie

Proche de nos clients, nous adressons des problématiques concrètes et cherchons au quotidien à améliorer l’utilisabilité de notre solution, que ce soit dans son utilisation standard sur PC ou sur nos écrans de diffusion tactiles au sein des usines.

Vos missions

Votre impact

Vous ferez partie d’une équipe de développement d’aujourd’hui trois personnes. Vous travaillerez sur Cockpit et Eurêka qui sont deux applications Angular qui communiquent avec un backend Spring Boot. Nous créons ce poste pour deux raisons principales :


d’augmenter notre capacité à délivrer de nouvelles fonctionnalités, ce qui inclura rapidement la création d'autres applications
compléter les compétences de l’équipe qui est aujourd'hui majoritairement backend

Vous serez donc force de proposition pour améliorer l’architecture de nos produits ainsi que les outils et processus utilisés :


être le porte-parole des problématiques frontend et UX au sein de l’équipe
maintenir et faire évoluer les fonctionnalités existantes en assurant l’ergonomie, la performance et la cohérence visuelle de la solution.
contribuer discussions liées au développement des nouvelles fonctionnalités et les nouveaux produits

Développements frontend de notre plateforme
Collaborer au quotidien avec les développeurs backend pour assurer une bonne cohésion d’équipe
Donner votre avis sur les évolutions de nos produits
Respecter les principes de qualité du code mis en place et produire des tests automatisés afin de faciliter la maintenance des produits
Maintenance et amélioration des applications Angular existante
Contribution au support client
Être force de proposition sur tout ce qui peut améliorer les produits ou la collaboration au sein de Kpitaine

Environnement technique


Angular / Spring Boot / PostgreSQL
Git / IntelliJ / Jira / Jenkins
Docker

Vos compétences

Nous souhaitons recruter un profil expérimenté afin de compléter les compétences de l’équipe de développement. Nous cherchons :


une personne autonome dans le développement de fonctionnalité frontend
à ce que les tests automatisés fassent partie intégrante de chaque développement
une expérience sur le framework Angular souhaitée et si vous avez déjà effectué une montée de version d’Angular ce sera un petit plus
de bonnes connaissances des principes et des outils du DevOps
une sensibilité naturelle à améliorer l’expérience utilisateur
une personne prête à partager ses connaissances avec le reste de l’équipe

Avantages

Kpitaine est une jeune entreprise en phase de croissance. Implantée depuis ses débuts dans le cadre idyllique du bassin annecien (oui, nous sommes biaisés), nous aimons le travail d’équipe et les activités de groupe (n’hésitez pas à jeter un coup d’œil à notre LinkedIn).

Nous sommes également mus par la volonté d’offrir un service de qualité au plus proche des besoins de nos utilisateurs. Nous avons un cycle de mise en production rapide, ce qui nous permet de mettre à disposition des fonctionnalités en quelques semaines. La boucle de rétroaction cliente est alors rapide et très satisfaisante.

En termes de télétravail, nous sommes ouverts à deux jours par semaine.

Nous serons ravis de recevoir vos candidatures si vous souhaitez tenter l’aventure d’une startup locale à taille humaine.

Rejoins l'équipe Kpitaine et participe à des projets innovants en tant que Développeur·se front Angular. Ambiance conviviale garantie!
